fields.headline: Beach cafe
fields.bodyText: A beachside cafe is a place of escape. As such, the Beach Hut's driftwood decor more than fits the bill, the views on to the surf could pass for Byron Bay on at least 10 days a year, as could the flotsam clientele with their wetsuits and sea-salt-matted hair. But it's the food served up by this former bucket and spade shop that really hits home. In Britain, tradition has generally dictated that a beach cafe's food should come straight from the deep freezer into the deep fryer, but the Beach Hut uses local suppliers to produce delicious, hearty no-fuss food, which sit alongside surf staples such as hot chocolate with marshmallows. Open all year round, which shows resilience, and makes the Beach Hut a powerful ally in the continual struggle against adversity that is the typical British beach experience. · Beach Hut (01637 860877)
